Instruction: Put the processed cheese and milk into a slow cooker.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, then cook and stir the beef until it's crumbly, browned evenly, and no longer pink. Drain off and discard any excess grease.
Mix in the diced tomatoes and taco seasoning with the ground beef, then bring to a boil.
Move the ground beef mixture to the slow cooker. Mix in the milk and processed cheese.
Cook on High until the cheese has melted, which should take around 1 hour.
